Recent updates from New York City include two highway fatalities, four pediatric flu deaths, and an apartment fire that claimed an 81-year-old man's life. Additionally, Mayor Mamdani signed an executive order to enhance sanctuary protections, while the city faces ongoing challenges with healthcare staffing shortages and snow removal responsibilities.

### Risks & Alerts

- Two fatalities reported on NY highways, including a man attempting to cross the Major Deegan. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiyAFBVV95cUxONlJqUzhVdlVoYktZcjRLdFZodjI5NUlXZm5MRFpFZU52X3p3NEtJR0d5am9wSWNLQWxTSzNWVUg3RWZHNUFuWGhIYV9UdDVPOUxpeDktY2RCWjRCQlJscDBXNW1pMlpIU01RNVJzUzBXdnc2R09mRzdDa3NuOUt2MjA0NjVTcW1ZYnp4X0FMMFBwNkdzVVptZkVxNVZYekNqcmtWcjAwNlYweG1fb3RlTzJXc1JYMEFSdUYtWmpQR2pud2xla1VnTw?oc=5)
- NYC reports four pediatric flu deaths, marking the first fatalities of the season. - An 81-year-old man died in an apartment fire in Borough Park, Brooklyn. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Nearly 70 people were rescued from malfunctioning gondolas at a New York ski mountain. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMif0FVX3lxTFBWNTBZbzR6TFBZbGtiNlZjaG1zZEFrNTR5WEtfQmY4aV9oV2VvaUtEMjNqUktqdHlOVk5ZQkpJMWZ1aVRvY3paTlFrT2x5dWhzMGVHZ0pVV1JvaWhuOFZMM0RzNDVNbzNkZERiY2NYSk9kQ3pQM1ZzMlA0bzdBdVE?oc=5)

[↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiggFBVV95cUxQU0U4ZHM3eUpuZGI5ZEF2dmhqTlNjWmtNWWE0X2tqWW5kM1h1TVFzbVZkUW5ILWpHS2ZnZUVBSl9rclFQNWxjYkNWNWhacm5nQmJaNmprejQ2ak15ZlJvcWdmQklyYnpxNE5hOEJyV05CQ19kVTNrLUJmY0RQaFJWeHV3?oc=5)
